tenders.detailedDescription: The contract will manage 172 escalators across the Transport for London (TfL) network. tenders.title: Development of public consultation for UISPC
tenders.summary: The Unified Information Standard for Protected Characteristics (UISPC), commissioned by the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC), is a comprehensive initiative designed to modernise and harmoni
tenders.detailedDescription: The Unified Information Standard for Protected Characteristics (UISPC), commissioned by the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC), is a comprehensive initiative designed to modernise and harmonise equality monitoring across the NHS in England. The programme provides a detailed review of workforce, employment, and patient datasets, as well as associated national surveys, and provides robust recommendations for updating equality monitoring arrangements by reference to protected characteristics across the NHS in England. It is designed to comply with a complex range of intersecting legal obligations, including those provided by the Equality Act 2010 and intersecting provisions in the NHS Act 2006, data protection laws, other regulatory provisions and national standards. It also advises on how to bring current NHS data collections into legal compliance following the For Women Scotland Supreme Court judgment.

tenders.title: Analysis of NHS Cost Drivers and Disparities Refresh (Year 2)
tenders.summary: The NHS Cost Drivers and Cost Disparities project aims to help trusts analyse their National Cost Collection (NCC) data to identify variations and disparities in costing that impact productivity. Year
tenders.detailedDescription: The NHS Cost Drivers and Cost Disparities project aims to help trusts analyse their National Cost Collection (NCC) data to identify variations and disparities in costing that impact productivity. Year 1 of the project was designed to support the Secretary of States desire to be assured that the NHS understanding of its cost base and understanding of cost drivers. The NCC provides some, but not all of the information needed and to address this, a project was undertaken. This used the 2023/24 NCC data which was available at the time of Year 1 project. Year 1 was delivered as part of the Local Cost Collection (LCC)/ Federated Data Platform (FDP) work to enable NHSE to start building in these requirements to future improving the planned output from future cost submissions to support trusts to pinpoint inefficiencies and improve operational performance. It also successfully increased engagement with costing processes at both trust and Integrated Care Board (ICB) levels, supporting productivity improvements in line with the NHS Long Term Plan.

tenders.detailedDescription: The overarching requirement of the project is to develop the RIBA Stage 3 Design into a complete RIBA Stage 4 Technical Design and subsequently build and commission the new Central Substation building (through RIBA Stage 5 and 6).   This project is split into two principal Phases as outlined below - a Design Phase (1) and a Build Phase (2), each with their own corresponding Work Packages.    In summary, this Project includes the following work packages:  Project Phase 1 (Design) includes the following work packages:  • WP 1: Survey and assessment work to facilitate the RIBA 4 design.  • WP 2: RIBA 4 Technical Design incl. all temporary works designs.  • WP 3: Undertake earthing design for Central Substation.  Project Phase 2 (Build) includes the following work package:  • WP 4: RIBA 5 and 6: Construct, Commission and Handover the works as designed in Phase 1.   Installation of HV/LV Electrical switch panels and associated cabling shall not form part of this work, and will follow as a separate project once WP 4 is complete.

tenders.detailedDescription: The contract is for an independent audit provider to carry out a mandatory assessment needed as part of the DSP Toolkit annual return for NHS England. tenders.detailedDescription: Mutual Exchange' (MX) is legal process available to social housing secure tenants, which entitles a tenant not in rent arrears and has a good tenancy record, to exchange their tenancy with another secure tenant, provided their housing needs match the intended property. Once an application is submitted, there is a statutory time limit of 42 days by which the landlord must make a decision and communicate it to the applicant.  The absence of a decision within 42 days entitles the applicant if so minded to go ahead and exchange the property.

tenders.title: Young Futures Panels Evaluation
tenders.summary: Summary:  We are looking to appoint an evaluation partner to review and support the Young Futures Panels Evaluation.   Specific Research Questions will include:   How, and to what extent, are the Youn
tenders.detailedDescription: Summary:  We are looking to appoint an evaluation partner to review and support the Young Futures Panels Evaluation.   Specific Research Questions will include:   How, and to what extent, are the Young Futures Panels (YFP) continuing to meet their objectives?    How have the Young Futures Panels been implemented across different areas of West Yorkshire and what are the key enablers and barriers to effective delivery?   How has the learning from the pilot stage been used to shape and refine YFP implementation and what are the advantages and disadvantages of this in West Yorkshire?    The proposed evaluation objectives include:   Examine the continued delivery of the YFP identifying areas of good practice and opportunities for further improvement and adaption.   Review each areas' theory of change to ensure they reflect current delivery.    Review all processes involved in the delivery of the YFP in each area, offering partners constructive recommendations for efficiency and supporting them to embed delivery as part of business as usual.   Examine the onward referral processes into local services, identify areas of improvement and support Panel members to implement recommendations.    Ensure that the perceptions of both young people in receipt of Panel support and professionals involved in the Panels are captured sufficiently to identify feedback loops and further ideas on improvement while gauging their general response to the process.    Support Panel members and the VRP to continually improve monitoring materials to support effective performance monitoring and impact evaluations.    Pilot and review how an impact evaluation could best be designed to capture the impact of Panels on intended outcomes and any other potential outcomes.    Provide detailed recommendations and an evaluation framework for the optimal design of an impact evaluation.   Develop implementation guidance to support the onboarding of other areas to develop and implement a YFP.

tenders.title: 704471450-MSS/143-PD3-003 CAN
tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Services, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: PLACE985ER Invest in Derbyshire Promotional Campaigns
tenders.summary: The Inward Investment team have been building a narrative for the county as a place where businesses want to invest and grow. We're providing our service on behalf of Derbyshire's districts and boroug
tenders.detailedDescription: The Inward Investment team have been building a narrative for the county as a place where businesses want to invest and grow. We're providing our service on behalf of Derbyshire's districts and boroughs and in collaboration with the East Midlands Combined County Authority (EMCCA). The project delivery requires extensive knowledge of Derbyshire and its economic landscape, so supplier's proven track record of projects focused on and located in Derbyshire or the wider East Midlands region is essential. The requirements are to develop (based on our suggested specification) and roll out a number of promotional campaigns on our behalf.

tenders.title: CWC26107 - St George's Pre Development Agreement
tenders.summary: The St Georges Programme is a major city centre regeneration initiative led by City of Wolverhampton Council. It focuses on transforming the former Sainsbury's site into a vibrant mixed-use developmen
tenders.detailedDescription: The St Georges Programme is a major city centre regeneration initiative led by City of Wolverhampton Council. It focuses on transforming the former Sainsbury's site into a vibrant mixed-use development, delivering new homes, commercial spaces and enhanced public realm. The scheme aims to support economic growth, create a strong leisure and evening economy, and align with the Council's strategic objectives for housing and city centre revitalisation. The programme is being delivered in partnership with Capital & Centric under a Pre-Development Agreement (PDA), via the Pagabo Developer Led Framework.
